Posts.Content: Hi limbo 1977! Please try not to worry! It won't Change a thing! Mine was grade 3 invasive ductal! I had a mastectomy no nodes involved and didn't need chemo or rads! Just taking tamoxifen!  chin up! X x x
Posts.Title: Biopsy Results....... I'll be around for a while

Posts.Content: Hi again Lamonsea! I see you've had many posts all advising you to do pretty much the same thing! I really understand how difficult it is to put yourself first but sometimes it just has to be done! I was in a really difficult situation when I was diagnosed with breast cancer 2 years ago! I was a carer for both my mum and husband! Told all the medical team I was far too busy to have cancer! Fortunately they talked to me and I had the necessary treatment an I'm here to tell the tale! Mum had to go into a nursing home and other people helped my husband! Have the treatment they suggest now! After Christmas things might be worse and you'd still need the treatment! Get it done and out of the way! Take care gill. X x x
Posts.Title: Delaying chemo

Posts.Content: Hi lamonsea! Try and slow down the panic! One step at a time! Firstly can I say how sorry I am to find yourself in this situation! However now's the time to put yourself first and without considering anyone else do the right thing for you! Tough I know but if you don't you could be unnecessarily shortening your life! Forget about past mistakes for now! If you haven't confidence in your breast care team then ask for a second opinion! If you need help with the children contact social service's/ friends and family! Just imagine if one of your children was putting off treatment for something really serious for 4 months! How would you feel what advice would you give her? Take care! Good luck on the journey and I'm sure you'll do the right thing! Gill x
Posts.Title: Delaying chemo

Posts.Content: Hi sal44! I'm much older than you and do'nt have your dilemma but just wanted to say that your definitely not being selfish in wanting to start a family! Anyone sadly can die from all sorts of illnesses/accidents so crack on and hopefully you can get pregnant without too much trouble! However I would speak to your oncologist because they will advise you as the best way to go about it! Good luck gill x x x Oh + by the way I have a cousin who before he had children made provision with friends to take care of child if anything were to happen to him! (He's perfectly fit and well) so that might be something to consider! Take care!
Posts.Title: Taking a break from tamoxifen for children

Posts.Content: Hi Nette 70! Sorry to hear you've not got your tooth sorted! Are you on active chemo at the moment or has it friends finished now! Gill x x . X
Posts.Title: Teeth after treatment part 2

Posts.Content: Hi tropicof! Please keep posting as you need to gets your thoughts down and people really do care on this site! I know it's primarily for cancer patients but because your struggling mentally you still need advice and support! I can only begin to imagine how difficult it must be for you trying to cope with your son as well as your own health! You really need some help from social services! What's your own GP like? Can you talk to them about All your health issues? I must admit I too am struggling emotionally at present since my husband died earlier this year but because of my son who I adore I will carry on at any price! If you can't fight for yourself do it for him! He still needs his mum around and hopefully for a long time to come! Do let me know how your getting along! Take care gill , , x
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: Hi again tropicof! Yes I'm awake as well! I've got a really bad sinus infection and just can't Blooming sleep! Right! This is my story! 2012 husband diagnosed with incurable cancer died this year. Dad died 2015 cancer! Me cancer 2015 breast! Mum has advanced Alzheimer's and is in a nursing home! I'm beyond exhausted and at times very depressed and have really bad anxiety attacks BUT we have to carry on! Of course both of us are going to die but we have to live for a while before that happens! Can I ask what your diagnosis was with breast cancer! Mine was invasive ductal early stage grade 3! Had mastectomy and I didn't nee chemo or radiotherapy just tamoxifen for 10 years! I'm due my 2nd yearly mammogram later this month! I do not at this point have secondary breast cancer but if that does develop can be treated for many years! I saw my husband and father fight so hard to live not just to stay with me but for themselves that I've decided ( and it really is a choice) to carry on living! Please don't give up! Take care gill x x x
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: Hope you have a good day! ( to tropicof)! I honestly thought you were much younger! Isn't it strange when you form mental pictures of people with just words! Now that doesn't mean your old but it must get harder as you age! I remember my dad at 70 had pretty bad arthritis! (Rheumatoid)! Some days he could barely walk! Do you have any other family around! I live about 11 miles outside liverpool and although my husband had a large family and they've helped a lot I'm an only child! So's my son! The only other family I have is an aunt in manchester who is as fit as a flea an about your age! She works all wee and visit me  + we go into see mum in nursing home! I do fee guilty about her being in there but I couldn't physically look after her on my own anymore! I'm convinced that the stress of the past few years has caused my cancer! Anyway let me know how your day goes! Even if we have a moan a problem shared eh! Gill x x x
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: Hi cords! Thanks for the post! All our journeys are so different yet held together by breast cancer! I think the more I use this site it makes me realize how different we all our and how we've all had different life experiences and mostly how it's really important not to pass judgement on each other! As I've discovered life really can flip at any moment! Until 5 years ago I'd had I suppose quite a privileged life! No money worries own home family + friends! Normal existence I thought! Then one by one the people who meant the most to me disappeared! I'm now trying to adopt the policy of being grateful for all I've had! Some days easy - others not so! Anyway umbrella at the ready + on my way to M+S! Some therapeutic shopping needed! Have a lovely day! Take care gill x x x
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: To tropicof! Just managed to leave your name off above post! ( starting to turn into a comedy of errors) hey ho! Gill x x x
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: Hi tropicof! Hope ur "day o.k.!  Thankfully sorted things out today at the NURSING home. Went far better than expected really! I think my problem is I always overthink everything instead of just relaxing about life! Also had to go and get my flu jab! The lovely nurse I see told me to try and stop worrying about everything and she said she believes what will be will  be! I wish I could just  adopt this theory! Life would be much simpler to deal with! I was a bit concerned when you mentioned not being sure if you'd see your son again! I do hope your both o.k.! Again my other current worry is my own son! He's finished uni now but doesn't seem all that sure of what to do next! He says he's taking a year out! Anyway ill file that away till tomorrow now! Take care gill x x x
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: Hi again tropicof! I'm so sorry about the problems your son is having! My mum has lived her life and although not really old still had a good life with my dad! She was a nurse for many years! The problem I have at the moment is guilt! I promised her I'd look after her and never put her in a home! I can no longer cope on my own as she needs so much care 24 hours a day! I cared for her for the last 10 years! It's heartbreaking! Anyway may I ask what your gynea app is for! I was referred by my GP about 5 months ago cos I'd had a heavy bleed! Turns out I've go a fibroid! Had to have a biopsy but luckily all o.k.! I just need yearly scans now to keep an eye on things! Take care and lovely to hear from you again.gill x x x
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: Hi tropicof! This is newdawn! Just to clarify if the above post was intended for me as there was no name on the post! If it was I'm very confused as to how I could have caused offence! Gill x
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: Hi! Please don't worry! My computer skills are awful! I'm trying to learn how to do banking online at the moment with very limited success! Just got back from shopping and now to face the next challenge of visiting mum! She doesn't recognise me now but it's still lovely to see her! Only problem is I can never manage to get home without crying! Take care gill x x x
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: Hi Mazza 10! I know I've replied to tropical in gentler terms but I admire your honesty! My husband was very much like you when helping me with my mental health issues and funnily enough his nickname was "Mazza"! I think the next time i'm in need of a good kick up the bum I'll kindly ask for your advice! Take care + hope you have a good day gill x x x
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: Hi (again)! Just read your last post! Would you be offended if I asked your age! I'm 53 soon and still relatively young! My son only 23! I'm not ready to leave him yet! I need to see him settled and doing o.k. before I bow out! It really is possible to live a quality life with disabilities cos many thousands of people do! Just try an keep a open mind about the future! Keep posting! X x x
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: Hi! Surgery first! Definitely! X x
Posts.Title: Offered choice of chemo before mastectomy or after - what would you...

Posts.Content: Hi wynneth! I had a mastectomy 2 years ago and am very happy still with my decision! No reconstruction! Scar very neat! However I know it's not for everyone! I have two friends who both had mastectomys and one chose no reconstructionn like me and is very happy! The other friend has opted for reconstruction and 2 years on is still having surgeries! All she wants is a lifelike breast! To some women it's very important! I was more concerned with getting rid of the tumour! I have to say that I'm only a 32C! So small prosthesis! Sometimes I don't even bother wearing one! My surgeon however said if I ever changed my mind to contact her! So maybe I'll change my mind! Can't imagine so! Hope all goes well! Gill x
Posts.Title: Offered choice of chemo before mastectomy or after - what would you...

Posts.Content: Hi Daytirose! I was in a very poor financial position when starting brest cancer treatment! Just wondered had you applied for a macmillan Grant! My breast care nurse gave me the firm and I received £300.00 which helped a lot at the time! Also contacted my lo all citizens advice bureau! The local council rant a grant scheme for people receiving treatment for things like replacement boilers/cookers/freezers etc! Again only recently I phoned my local council to apply for a blue badge and they put me through to another dept which offered help to people on a low income with a disability call a "handyperson" scheme" any small jobs in the home were done for free! Worthwhile having  good ring around and simply asking what helps available! Take care gill x x x
Posts.Title: ESA

Posts.Content: Hi Angela A! I used to work for the benefits agency many moons ago and it's all changed since I was there but what you need to do is ask your go for a private letter explaing your situation! ( there might be a fee)! Send this to the benefits agency with a letter from yourself explaining the situation! Hopefully an adjudication officer will review your claim and you will be put in the support group pronto! Take care and good luck with your treatment! Gill x x
Posts.Title: ESA

Posts.Content: Hi! If I were you I'd try the recommended treatment and "if" you experience any unmanageable side effects simply stop taking them! X
Posts.Title: Declining further treatment after breast surgery

Posts.Content: Hi! Just read ur  post and thought I'd share my experience of taking tamoxifen( been taking since last Dec! My side effects have been leg cramps/ joint pain and yes the dreaded weight gain! I've put on about a stone over a 12 month period! I'm afraid I've not got any useful tips on dieting but I simply try to eat a healthy balanced diet and try and exercise more than I used to! ( which appears to have made no difference at all )! On the plus side cancers gone and will hopefully stay that way so I'd definately rather not have cancer and be a bit overweight! Remember that everyone's different so just give it a go with an open mind! Take care gill x x x
Posts.Title: Weight gain with Tamixifen

Posts.Content: Hi! Go without! Loads of people have short hair! Good luck! X x x x
Posts.Title: Job interview

Posts.Content: Hi! I was diagnosed 2 years ago and was taking tamoxifen! Stopped and started bleeding ! Went to see my GP and had blood test and iron slightly low so needed iron tablets! My GP REFERRED me for gyni opinion and it turns out I have a fibroid that was causing problems! Anyway they are monitoring me and I'm going for scan in 12 months! Might be worth contacting your GP! Take care gill x x x
Posts.Title: Chemo induced menopause and then .....

Posts.Content: Hi! I'm not taking letrozol but on tamoxifen and have had quite e few water infections recently! My GP usually prescribes trimethorprim then sends sample off! If anything different is required they ring me when results are back! What I find really helpful is cranberry juice! Stops the burning and if you take regularly it can help stop the infection sticking to bladder wall! (allegedly!) Worth a try at least! Hope your feeling better soon x x x
Posts.Title: Letrozole and UTI

Posts.Content: HiNN17! You need a copy of your path report! Contact your surgeons Secretary at the hospital! If you were given a breast care nurse now's the time to start ringing and asking questions! Your bound to be panicky at the moment but things will settle! I'm not medically trained but I don't think this necessarily changes the stage of the cancer! Take care gill!  X x oh and by the way it's your body and you are in control of which treatments you agree to at any given point an also whether to continue with them! X x x
Posts.Title: Grade of Cancer changed after Surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy! Only think I know the answer to this question cos husband has had stem cell transplant! The type of chemo does not destroy bone marrow (which produces blood cells) so even though they drop for a bit and your more at risk of all infections , once they increase again you would still have immunity to all the really bad diseases! Good luck + fingers crossed you wont,catch anything " unwanted"  GILL Xxx
Posts.Title: Antibodies

Posts.Content: Hi LCD! Firstly can I just say how sorry I am your having to go through all this rubbish! You sound like a very educated + capable person who has been set off course by illness and you need help but on your terms! I think you need to be more assertive + specific when it comes to either asking for or accepting help from others! Tell people if there not being helpful "politely" and if they truly care they'll understand! If you want the bathroom painting then get it done! It's your house! Take back control! You'll feel better! Love + best wishes gill x
Posts.Title: loss of autonomy

Posts.Content: Thanks jess! These things should come naturally really! I find it a bit sad that we need reminding! X
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi  Chloecat! I'm absolutely intrigued reading your posts because I've never even heard of some of the treatments available! I suppose if your lucky enough to be near a larger hospital they have more to offer! I must say I fee like I never put nearly enough time and effort into the whole research thing when I was diagnosed 2 years ago! Same type of cancer as yourself! I simply went Down the mastectomy route! No questions asked!  Could I ask (and you don't have to say if you prefer not to)! But why did you not think a mastectomy was the best approach at the time for yourself? I'm starting to doubt my ow choices now! Take care and good luck with planned treatment! Gill x x x
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi GK1! Just wanted to say I'm 52 and have been taking tamoxifen for 2 years with only mild joint stiffness! I remember speaking to my breast nurse about side effects and the negative things I'd read in this site and she said usually only people post on here who are actually having problems! When I thought about it it makes sense really! So I suppose the vast majority of people have manageable side effects and think it's worthwhile taking! You can always stop it at any stage if your not happy! Gill x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen for post menopausal women

Posts.Content: Hi Ella 70! In reply to your post about telling people about your diagnosis then everyone does this in their own way! No right or wrong! I decided to tell the people who needed to know like very close family and friends then everyone else would find out gradually over time or maybe never know! Again it depends on your willingness to share very personal info on-line! Don't get me wrong social media is great for most things but just not sure it's the right forum for telling a wide circle of people you have cancer! I've read loads of stories in news + from meeting people and lots of people do still choose to be selective in who they tell! I personally did not want to make people feel they had to get in touch solely because of my diagnosis! This worked for me but I think what you have to decide is do you want well meaning folk talking to you about your health every time you meet or speak to them! I found I needed days where I switched off and forgot about the whole thing sometimes! Good luck in whatever you decide and I hope your treatment going s well! Gill x x x
Posts.Title: How to tell friends?

Posts.Content: Hi RAGGARTY! Hang in there! Things will get better! Try changing your brand of tamoxifen! Some are better than others when it comes to side effects so it's trial an error! I take wockhardt! Nowhere near as  many side effects as other brands I've tried! Do you still take any anti sickness tabs! Might be worth asking your GP for some to tide you over till things settle down! Also I know we all need to pay the bills but if your really struggling consider a break from work if it's possible! Take care + good luck gill x x x
Posts.Title: Bad few days

Posts.Content: Hi! I had my mastectomy sept15 and am also size 32c! ( bit older than u though I'm 52!) I've tried everywhere for bras and have come to the conclusion that amoena is  by far the best! However I only buy bras + matching knickers in the sale! Because it's an unusual size they always seem to have plenty of 32c in sale! It just means stocking up when there available! On the plus side I have a couple of larger breasted friends who have both had mastectomy with no recon  and they always comment on the weight of their prosthesis ( especially in summer)! Hope this helps! X x x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras!

Posts.Content: Hi londonlass! I too have terrible acid reflux and I think stress plays a huge part! I'm taking omeprazole/gaviscon/ and it does help a little! Maybe try upping the dose before you go to bed and don't lie flat! ( easier said than done) as I'm forever falling off pillows + ending up lying flat! On a more serious note acid reflux is a definite risk factor in developing oesophogeal problems including sadly cancer so do try + get it sorted! Take care gill x x x
Posts.Title: My Night....
